qas.question: In what year did Sony and Philips band together to design a new digital audio disc?
What year was the Red Book CD-DA standard released?
When did the IEC isntigate the Red Book CD-DA as an international standard?
Who headed the 1979 Sony and Philips digital audio disc task force?

answers.text: Kees Schouhamer Immink and Toshitada Doi

qas.question: Which company did Kees Schouhamer Immink work for?
What did the team create five years after joining?

context: As a result, in <a0_0>1979<a0_0/>, <b4_0>Sony<b4_0/> and Philips set up a joint task force of engineers to design a new digital audio disc. Led by engineers <a3_0>Kees Schouhamer Immink and Toshitada Doi<a3_0/>, the research pushed forward <b8_0>laser and optical disc technology<b8_0/>. After a year of experimentation and discussion, the task force produced the <b5_0>Red Book CD-DA standard<b5_0/>. First published in <a1_0>1980<a1_0/>, the standard was formally adopted by the <b7_0>IEC<b7_0/> as an <b6_0>international standard<b6_0/> in <a2_0>1987<a2_0/>, with various amendments becoming part of the standard in 1996.
